title: Checking In On Afghanistan As NATO Talks Begin
teaser: The presidential election is still unresolved, the Taliban continues to commit and threaten violence and the economy is hurting.
contentencoded:
In Afghanistan, the presidential election is still unresolved, the Taliban continues to commit and threaten violence, and the economy is hurting badly. NPR’s Sean Carberry is in Kabul and tells Here & Now’s Robin Young that it’s been an anxious few months in Afghanistan, and the plans being discussed at the NATO Summit in Wales this week.

Guest

  • Sean Carberry, NPR international correspondent in Kabul. He tweets @frankentele.
